title: Album Page, "Campaniles, Venice", October 23, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick white wove paper, adhered to a sheet of thin, white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper left corner: 84; upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 73; clockwise from left: San Francisco [sic] / della Vigna; San Giorgio / Maggiore; San Marco; Campaniles [sic] of / Venice / Oct 23rd 1887.
description: Narrow, vertical sheet that has been cut down, with pinholes in three corners.  Three well known campanile (bell towers) of Venice are depicted: at upper left, the campanile of San Francesco della Vigna; at upper right, the campanile of San Giorgio Maggiore; at bottom, the campanile of San Marco.  Each is a slender masonry structure with an arcaded belfry culminating in a tall steeple with finial. The campanile of San Francesco and San Giorgio are both reddish brown, likely indicating brick masonry, while the tower of San Marco is a pale gray with creamy white belfry, possibly indicating a type of marble.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Campaniles, Venice", October 23, 1887.
October 23, 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick white wove paper, adhered to a sheet of thin, white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-3.
